text:
Hello @everyone ,

Anyone tried to display deals filtered by company association label . Let me know how we can achieve this kind of feature. Thanks

Is something like this ?
```crm_associations(associated_companies.results[0].id, 'HubSpot_DEFINED', 6, "label=Partner Company", 'dealname,amount,dealstage,createdate,closedate') %}```

so the "6" in that function is the association label, (company to deal right?) and if you change the HubSpot_DEFINED to USER_DEFINED and change the number to the association type id (of the association label) you can pull in just those associations

<@UKJSMBW6A> Did you figure out a solution to this?  I have a client who wants each subscription to have sub subscriptions and when they unsubscribe from an email, to only show a limited number of items (subscription and sub-subscription) on the unsubscribe page (including the unsubscribe all) and specific branding dealing with the main subscription.  I thought using a query would be a way to do it, but I had the same issue as you where it wasn't reading the query.  Would love to see how yours worked out
oh man you're really gonna test my memory here... i'd need to remember where I did this

In this case, I can just use a template literal around it like
```callback: `{{ module.callback }}````
But thatâ€™s still need really a solution, since the callback string could have template literals in it.
